result.execSummary:
The defendant Brooks D Benson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Harmful Material-Expose Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
As of 12/27/2017:   Pursuant to Supreme Court decision in State v Elward, 2015 WI App 51, 363, DNA surcharge is vacated and modified to zero.  Department of Corrections to address financial obligations related to DNA surcharge.

Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No Contact with victim, C.R.M. or her family. No Use of the internet except for school and banking purposes with approval of agent. No unsupervised contact with any minors except family members. Maintain full time employment and/or school.  Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brooks D Benson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: re: DNA surcharge modification letter signed by Judge Ralph M. Ramirez.

Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Terminated
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Brooks D Benson in court with Attorney Paul Bugenhagen.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentence hearing.  State files an amended information.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1 on amended information.   Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 on amended information.  State makes sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Bugenhagen makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

9 MONTHS HUBER (CREDIT - _ days)

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____No Use of the internet (except for school and banking purposes with approval of agent)  
____No unsupervised contact with any minors (except family members)
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: victim C.R.M. or her family 

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Brooks D Benson in court with Attorney Paul Bugenhagen.  Timothy F Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bugenhagen requests a plea and sentence date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Brooks D Benson in court with attorney Paul Bugenhagen.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for April 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 7, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Defendant to have no contact with the witness listed in the complaint and any minor children. No access to any social network or video chat. Access to the internet for personal access only

Defendant Brooks D Benson in court with attorney Paul Bugenhagen.  Barbara Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2014 at 08:15 am.
